intro: Aeranthes henrici var. isaloensis, commonly known as the Isalo orchid, is a rare and endemic species found in Madagascar. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, often growing on tree trunks or in rocky crevices. Its leaves are elongated and革质 (leathery), adapted to retain moisture in its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
